page.title: 02SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The sewage works are situated to the south of Lime Vale Road. They deal with all the houses and shops in the Billinge area. The first process combs the larger pieces of waste away. The storm tanks collect the excess rain water,it returns to the pipes when the level drops. The sewage then has the smaller bits of waste removed by a revolving drum. The dirty water is then filtered,by going through lots of layers of stones where bacteria eat all the waste before it is emptied into a stream which takes it to Carr Mill Dam. The water sent out of the works is 80% pure water, it is not fit to drink. . The waste that is left is put into beds to dry out, it is then taken away by a private contractor who eventually sells it as fertiliser.Only two men work at the sewage works.
